SH.content: Buchecker (beechmast), book corners, sharp, gaping edges of a text

LOBL.content: double affirmation: of death which triumphs over life, & triumph of life at edge of death
Blanchot’s narrative held together w/ invisible hinge, double inner edge (bord)

PAS.content: at the indistinct edge of sea, viens said just once between us

F.content: je m’arrête ici, déjà (tombe en arrêt [vault to a stop]), setting on the “edge of the crypt” a voiceless word, a blank stone of a scruple [see p. xlviii], to engage others to it, of a crypt

SPOM.content: the event we are prowling around (autour duquel nous rôdon) hesitates btwn singular “who” of ghost and general “what” of simulacrum; in dis-locaton, in virtual space of tele-technosciences, le messianique tremble au bord de cet événement même

DS.content: at the edge of being (au bord de l’être): the entre of the hymen, masked gap, veil of virginity (where nothing’s taken place) & consummation, penetration of antre, release [one in the other] > mirror never passed through, ice never broke, at the edge of being
“themes” run aground (échoue) at edge lesser & greater than theme, where “there is” a text is made a possibility, a readability w/out signified (fright’s reflex declares: unreadable)

POS.content: gathering Derrida’s work into a “sheaf,” historic/systematic crossroads, is structural impossibility of limiting network of differance, of putting an edge on its weave, not a master-word, always finds itself in others

P.content: philosophy always against parergon, parerga (Plato’s Laws, Aristotle’s Nichomachean Ethics); Kant on color, ornament
parergon: il est d’abord l’àbord (on board, the border), bord as plank, hylē, wood, bordel
two limits of edge: 1) internal, btwn frame & painting 2) external, separating from wall
everything will flower at the edge of a deconstructed tomb [see ATIA p. 29 limitrophy]

Kant’s beauty [wild tulip] requires absolute interruption: straining toward end w/out goal, not pure if cut can be bandaged (pansable), no pure cut (if it could be prolonged, completed, supplemented), no beauty > everything in it straining toward the bout (end, blow)
this fascination w/out desire, in view of an end never in view, a but en blanc [“point blank”] > interrupted finality must show itself as finality & interrupture, as edging
it is the sans that counts for beauty, la bordure [edging] en sans de la coupure pure
sharpen point(s)/edge (tranchant): [be more rigorous] (il faut bien aiguiser les pointes, les lames ou les fils…)
column & colossal (indissociable, nothing to do together): together see nothing, let nothing be seen, show nothing, display none of what one thinks
taille: size and cut (the cutting edge) [see TN. decision to use “cise”]
kolossos originally had no size, what brings cise (taille) to colossus, not a measured cise but disproportionate (démesurante) cise

OTO.content: Dionysus vs. Crucified, name of versus, countername, suffices to pluralize (in a singular fashion) homonymic mask & proper name, to lead all threads of name astray in labyrinth (ear): proceed, then, by seeking out the edges, inner walls, the passages

ATIA.content: discussion is interesting [re: animals] once limit is abyssal (rather than limit as discontinuity): once frontier is not a single, indivisible line, but more than one internally divided lines (folds, foliations): “what are the edges of a limit that feed on an abyss?”

SW.content: this irreducible reality of an event (outside discourse but not text)—is so unlike you? > but, it’s the signature, a hem, on the edge, forever heterogenous, a tear, overlap, remaining caught in poetic stitches—thus the effects of anticipated iterability

TB.content: at edge of the language, from this edge to the other of proper name: debt contracts the trait (to-be-translated from one language to the other) of relation of living subject to his name

REST.content: Heidegger & Shapiro, a pairing-together in difference of opinion, l’énigme d’un ajustement complémentaire des deux côtés, one edge to the other (d’un bord à l’autre)

for Heidegger, the picture is doubly useless, depicts, “shows,” being-products that’re out-of-service, w/out use-value > multiple edge(s) (bordures) detach being-product from subjective scope (portée subjective), simultaneously baiting (inducing/luring) reattachment of subjective scope
edge (bordure) less simple when turned inside out [invaginated?], not simple at all w/ the lace & the hemmed holes (trous bordés), the eyelets comme lieu de passage [figure of decapitation here too]

EL.content: edge (bord) of this reading, as on edge of “those abysses of abysses”
experience of the edge (bord) [sacrifice?], abyss btwn 2 places: sacred & non-sacred

HST.content: the unlivable contradiction of extending (du tendre) and waiting (de l’attendre); hantise (figure of visitation w/out invitation), au bord de la mort: it is to death that hospitality destines itself

PPT.content: partition of edge occurs everywhere (se passe partout) (in this book), protocol-frame is multiplied endlessly: lemmata, parerga, exergues, cartouches ——essential parasitizing opens every system to its outside, divides unity of the line (trait) purported to mark the system’s edges
trait acts as a passe-partout: multiplies dealings and transactions (contraband, graft and parasitizing among them); still, passe-partout must formally answer to finite system of constraints
[external edge of passe-partout is the one closest to the painting?]
le trait il s’y attire et s’y passe, de lui-même: situated, situates, btwn visible edging (la bordure visible) and phantom in center—from which we fascinate

+R.content: “the angle is always for me the edge of a tomb (un bord de tombe)”
plus d’air, plus r [+R]; each letter, especially gl: re-marks the slippery surface, angled word, edge of tomb, hooked (crochue) signature

LI.content: signature is on the edge of the text (neither inside nor outside)

TN.content: logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)
one would also have to integrate the rhetoric, plus qu’une rhétorique quand elle franchit à chaque figure the limits btwn sensible/intelligible—finding itself on both sides of the limit

ATM.content: “he will have obligated (il aura obligé),” a phrase knotted up (se noue) in a certain way of tying (lier), a serial structure of a singular type > edges of the sentence in fog, belong to the night

AD.content: discern edges of abyss: it’s not necessarily a bad abyss

LG.content: law can’t edge through (inabordable) nor edge away from (indébordable) the counterlaw (contre-loi) that constitutes it: reasons of edges (bords)
edge (bord), borderline (ligne de bordure), overflowing (débordement) do not arise w/out a fold—which figure of folding? [the answer: double chiasmatic invagination]

in Blanchot’s La folie du jour, one reads (sees w/out seeing) the crumbling (effondrement) of the upper edge, initial edge, the one regulated by common law [as first line] > forms a pocket inside corpus, invagination: trait of first line, borderline, splits while remaining the same—traverses the corpus it bounds

there is only content w/out edge, w/out boundary, w/out frame, there is only edge w/out content: interminable inocclusive invagination (inenarrable, unarrestable, insatiable) > terrible for those who require order in the name of the law
a lower edge of invagination intersects invagination of upper edge: trait splits again into an internal & external edge
what happens when edge pronounces a sentence?

SPEC.content: curtains, veils, “skirt” of bed, hymen of fort:da, edge of bed (lit) [of reading?], va-et-vient, there would’ve been a hymen even w/out curtains > veil of this “skirt” is interest of bed (lit) and fort:da of all these generations

[Derrida clearly explains the difference btwn fort/da and fort:da] “skirt” of bed, which hides the bars, forms inner chamber of fort/da, double screen which divides w/in itself—but dividing only by reassembling it w/ itself, sticking (piquant) to itself doubly, fort:da
